Introduction to workflow optimization using LLMs, emphasizing that private enterprise data is a key market differentiator and establishing a proof-of-concept using cybersecurity reports.

A comparison of machine learning implementation strategies, specifically weighing the portability and data-structuring benefits of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) against the high-precision but high-cost nature of LLM tuning.
An overview of RAG as a foundational entry point for LLM workflows, used to convert unstructured data into structured formats and establish data quality and authorization protocols.
Integration of Pydantic agents in agentic AI, highlighting their role as a type-safe, portable foundation for wrapping iterative LLM calls across different providers.
A technical architecture summary featuring a hybrid model that utilizes cloud-based LLM APIs alongside local vector databases for dual-use web and command-line applications.
A case study of the 'A Bridge Too Far' project, detailing a Python-based implementation using Django and ChromaDB to perform semantic searches on security vulnerabilities like XSS.
